dmca.title: Is Everything Up To Date with UpToDate When It's Alleging Copyright Infringement... I
dmca.body:
Dear [Private],

         Notice of Copyright Infringement (17 U.S.C. 512(c)(3))

    I am the Permissions Editor of UpToDate, Inc., the publisher of the UPTODATE(R) medical information database.  I am writing to inform you that a user of your system or network is publishing copyrighted material owned by UpToDate, Inc. at the following website address:

http://www.mail-archive.com/pituitarytumor@groups.msn.com/msg01116.html

    The publication of the above material represents violation and infringement of UpToDate's copyrights.  UpToDate insists that you remove the above material from your website immediately.

    I have a good faith belief that the above-referenced publication is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agents, or the law, and assert that the information in this Notice of Copyright Infringement is accurate, based on the data available to us.  Under penalty of perjury, I submit that I am authorized to act on behalf of UpToDate, Inc.

    Should you have any questions, please contact me at the address below.  If the above materials are not removed within 10 days of the date of this letter, UpToDate reserves its rights to take further action.

Sincerely

[Private]
Permissions Editor
UpToDate
[private]
Wellesley, MA 02481
[private]@uptodate.com
